p: The beneficial effect on the catalytic overpotential when transitioning from a µ‐pdt to a µ‐adt bridge suggests that modification of the bridging ligand could be key to lowering the overpotential. The class of hydrogenase mimics based on a bridging pyridine–monothiolato ligand is relatively unexplored. The synthesis of such complexes has been described from the corresponding thioester, 17 and to the best of our knowledge there is only one earlier report on the catalytic activity in the presence of acetic acid. 18
